src:
Uradna razglasitev: Delova podjetniška zvezda leta 2019 je podjetje Intra lighting
Svojega favorita so izbrali tudi bralci Dela.
07 Nov 2019, 19:31 by S. N.



Odgovorni urednik dela Uroš Urbas. FOTO: Tomi Lombar, Delo



Govornik na podelitvi nagrade Delove podjetniške zvezde je bil tudi predsednik DZ Dejan Židan. FOTO: Tomi Lombar, Delo



Podelitev nagrad Delove podjetniške zvezde. FOTO: Tomi Lombar, Delo



Podelitev nagrad Delove podjetniške zvezde. FOTO: Tomi Lombar, Delo



Podelitev nagrad Delove podjetniške zvezde. FOTO: Tomi Lombar, Delo


KRANJ – Na Delovem poslovnem dogodku leta v Kongresnem centru Brdo pri Kranju so razglasili dobitnika naziva Delova podjetniška zvezda.  Medijska hiša Delo letos nadaljuje projekt Delove podjetniške zvezde, v okviru katerega smo lanskega novembra drugič podelili prestižni kipec enemu izmed nominiranih in po presoji strokovne žirije najboljših malih in srednjih podjetij v državi – prejelo ga je škofjeloško podjetje Polycom.



 Letos smo na podlagi seznama malih in srednjih podjetij, ki ga je pripravil partner projekta, Agencija RS za javnopravne evidence in storitve (Ajpes), izmed ožjega izbora 138 podjetij izbrali deset nominirancev, tj. podjetij, ki so izvozno in razvojno naravnana, s poslovnimi modeli prihodnosti, ki jih uporabljajo za utrjevanje položaja na trgu. Nominirana podjetja imajo najmanj tri milijone evrov letnih prihodkov, najmanj pet zaposlenih, dodana vrednost na zaposlenega pa znaša najmanj 35.000 evrov – medtem ko je najvišja dodana vrednost znašala kar 155.929 evrov. Nominiranci so leta 2018 skupaj ustvarili malo več kot 147 milijonov evrov čistih prihodkov od prodaje, več kot 13,4 milijona evrov denarnega toka iz poslovanja in nekaj več kot 7,6 milijona evrov čistega dobička. 
Delova podjetniška zvezda 2019
 Delovo podjetniško zvezdo je izbrala strokovna komisija, v kateri so bili poleg predstavnikov uredništva še predsednik komisije Stojan Petrič, predsednik nadzornega sveta skupine Kolektor, ter člani komisije: mag. Aleš Cantarutti, državni sekretar na Ministrstvu za gospodarski razvoj in tehnologijo RS, prof. dr. Dušan Mramor, profesor na Ekonomski fakulteti Univerze v Ljubljani, Iztok Novak, direktor podjetja Polycom Škofja Loka in dobitnik nagrade Delova podjetniška zvezda leta 2018, in Luka Podlogar, MBA, predsednik uprave Generali Investments. 
Intra lighting iz Mirna
 Podjetje Intra lighting je komisijo prepričalo z odličnimi finančnimi kazalniki, uspehom na tujih trgih z lastnim izdelkom in blagovno znamko, usmerjenostjo v razvoj, dizajn in zadovoljevanje potreb kupca, trajnostno naravnanostjo ter vizijo in ambicioznimi načrti. Proizvajalec arhitekturnih svetil, svetlobnih sistemov in pametnih rešitev razsvetljave iz Mirna pri Novi Gorici, ki je v lasti družine Furlan, je hitrorastoče, vendar stabilno podjetje. Čisti prihodki od prodaje so med letoma 2015 in 2018 zrasli za 87 odstotkov, na 31 milijonov evrov, od tega 88 odstotkov izvozijo v 68 držav okoli 500 kupcem. Še višja je rast denarnega toka iz poslovanja EBITDA, ki je v tem času zraslo z 1,2 milijona evrov na štiri milijone evrov, čisti dobiček pa z dobrih 140.000 evrov na 3,1 milijona evrov. Podjetje je bistveno izboljšalo dodano vrednost na zaposlenega, ki tako dosega za slovensko gospodarstvo nadpovprečnih 75.139 evrov. Stabilnost zagotavlja nezadolženost, saj je kazalnik neto dolga/EBITDA 1,49, delež dolgov v financiranju pa 28,59 odstotka. Poleg dobrih finančnih rezultatov Intra lighting gradi trdne temelje za prihodnost tudi z vlaganjem okoli 11 odstotkov prihodkov v raziskave in razvoj, preusmeritvijo podjetja iz produktno naravnanega v usmerjenega v uporabnika, z digitalizacijo procesov in sodelovanjem z izobraževalnimi ustanovami. Podjetje je bilo v zadnjih štirih letih dvakrat uspešno na evropskih projektih Eureka, kar kaže na usmerjenost v razvoj in mednarodno okolje. Raziskujejo in uveljavljajo neskončne možnosti, ki jih lahko dajo svetilkam. Ustvarjajo svetilke, ki bodo imele vonj in dodatne zaslone ter absorbirale hrup, se z ljudmi pogovarjale in se bodo v 99 odstotkih približale sončni svetlobi. Poudarjajo dizajn, kakovost in servis. Z lastno slovensko blagovno znamko so priznani med arhitekti in vlagatelji po svetu, na zahtevnem italijanskem trgu so celo med vodilnimi tremi ponudniki. Poudarjamo tudi trajnostno naravnanost podjetja. Svetila izdelujejo iz materialov, ki se v 93 odstotkih lahko reciklirajo, 42 odstotkov energije pridobijo iz lastne sončne elektrarne in nameravajo postati samopreskrbni, njihovi novejši avtomobili so hibridi … Vse navedeno daje trdna zagotovila, da bo podjetje Intra lighting uresničilo ambiciozne cilje 50 milijonov evrov prihodkov v petih letih ter vstop na vse celine z lastnimi podjetji in proizvodnjo ter da bo njihova zvezda sijala še naprej. 
Preostalih devet podjetij, ki so se potegovala za laskavi naziv
 Adheziv, A-soft, Avant car, Controlmatik ABW, Inea, Plastika Skaza, Real security, Robeta in Sap. Podjetja so predstavljena na spletni strani https://www.delo.si/delove-podjetniske-zvezde. 
In zvezda po izboru bralcev Dela
 Bralci Dela pa so na spletu za svojega favorita izbrali podjetje Inea iz Ljubljane, ki so mu podelili posebno priznanje Delove podjetniške zvezde 2019 po izboru bralcev. 
Podporniki projekta
 Projekt so podprli generalni pokrovitelj Generali Investments, veliki pokrovitelji Deloitte, Mercedes, Riko in Zavarovalnica Triglav, pokrovitelja FMR in Holding slovenske elektrarne, partnerji BTC, Klub slovenskih podjetnikov, Ljubljanske mlekarne, Pivovarna Laško Union, SIQ Ljubljana, Slovenski podjetniški sklad, Slowatch, Steklarna Hrastnik, Športna loterija, Telekom Slovenije in Transformacija, strokovni partner Ajpes in programski partner Planet GV.
text:
Official announcement: The 2019 corporate star is Intra lighting
Readers of Delo also chose their favorite.
07 Nov 2019, 19:31 by S. N.



Editor-in-Chief Uroš Urbas. PHOTO: Tommy Lombar, Delo



Speaker at the Deluxe Entrepreneur Star Award was also Speaker of the National Assembly Dejan Židan. PHOTO: Tommy Lombar, Delo



Delo Entrepreneurial Star Awards. PHOTO: Tommy Lombar, Delo



Delo Entrepreneurial Star Awards. PHOTO: Tommy Lombar, Delo



Delo Entrepreneurial Star Awards. PHOTO: Tommy Lombar, Delo


KRANJ - At the Del Business Event of the Year at the Brdo Congress Center at Kranj, the winner of the Del Business Entrepreneur Star title was announced. The Delo media company is continuing the project of Delo Entrepreneurial Star this year, in which we awarded the prestigious statue to one of the nominees for the second time last November, and at the discretion of the jury of the best small and medium-sized enterprises in the country - it was awarded to the Diocese of Polycom.



This year, we selected ten nominees from the shortlist of 138 companies, based on the list of small and medium-sized enterprises prepared by the project partner, the Agency of the Republic of Slovenia for Public Legal Records and Related Services (AJPES). companies that are export-oriented and development-oriented, with business models of the future that they use to solidify their position in the market. Nominated companies have at least three million euros in annual revenue, at least five employees, and added value per employee is at least 35,000 euros - while the highest value added was as high as 155,929 euros. In 2018, the nominees combined generated just over € 147 million in net sales revenue, more than € 13.4 million in operating cash flow and just over € 7.6 million in net profit.
Part of the 2019 corporate star
Del's entrepreneurial star was selected by a committee of experts, which included, in addition to representatives of the editorial board, Stojan Petrič, chairman of the Supervisory Board of the Kolektor Group, and members of the commission: Mag. Aleš Cantarutti, State Secretary, Ministry of Economic Development and Technology of the Republic of Slovenia, prof. dr. Dušan Mramor, professor at the Faculty of Economics, University of Ljubljana, Iztok Novak, director of Polycom Škofja Loka and winner of the Delovo Entrepreneurial Star Award in 2018, and Luka Podlogar, MBA, CEO of Generali Investments.
Intra lighting from Mirna
Intra lighting convinced the commission with excellent financial indicators, success in foreign markets with its own product and brand, focus on development, design and customer satisfaction, sustainable orientation and vision and ambitious plans. The manufacturer of architectural lighting, lighting systems and smart lighting solutions from Mirno near Nova Gorica, owned by the Furlan family, is a fast-growing but stable company. Net sales grew 87 percent between 2015 and 2018 to 31 million euros, of which 88 percent were exported to 68 countries in about 68 countries. EBITDA's cash flow grew even higher during the period, from € 1.2 million to € 4 million, and net profit from a good € 140,000 to € 3.1 million. The company has significantly improved the value added per employee, which in this way reaches an average of EUR 75,139 for the Slovenian economy. Stability guarantees debt, with a net debt / EBITDA ratio of 1.49 and a debt-to-finance ratio of 28.59 percent. In addition to good financial results, Intra lighting builds a solid foundation for the future by investing around 11 percent of its R&D revenue, moving the company from product-oriented to customer-centric, digitizing processes and collaborating with educational institutions. The company has been successful twice in the past four years on Eureka's European projects, which shows its focus on development and the international environment. They research and exercise the endless possibilities that lamps can give. They create lamps that will have a scent and extra screens and absorb noise, talk to people and get closer to sunlight in 99 percent. They emphasize design, quality and service. With their own Slovenian brand, they are recognized by architects and investors around the world, and even in the demanding Italian market, they are among the leading three providers. We also emphasize the sustainability of the company. The lamps are made from 93 percent recyclable materials, 42 percent energy from their own solar power plant and intend to become self-sufficient, their newer cars are hybrids ... All of these provide solid assurances that Intra lighting will meet the ambitious $ 50 million revenue goals in five years, and entering all continents with their own businesses and production and that their star will continue to shine.
The other nine companies vying for the flattering title
Adhesive, A-soft, Avant car, Controlmatik ABW, Inea, Plastic Skaza, Real security, Robeta and Sap. The companies are presented on the website https://www.delo.si/parts-companies-stars.
And a star by choice readers of Acts
The readers of Delo, on the web, have chosen Inea from Ljubljana as their favorite, and have been given a special recognition of Delo's Entrepreneurial Star 2019 by readers' choice.
Supporters of the project
The project was supported by general sponsor Generali Investments, major sponsors Deloitte, Mercedes, Riko and Zavarovalnica Triglav, sponsors FMR and Holding Slovenian Power Plant, partners BTC, Club of Slovenian Entrepreneurs, Ljubljana Dairy, Pivovarna Lasko Union, SIQ Ljubljana, Slovenian Enterprise Fund, Slowatch, Steklarna Hrastnik, Sports Lottery, Telekom Slovenije and Transformation, Ajpes expert partner and Planet GV program partner.
